text: Is there a way for a user to select a table with a module hubdb table field AND THEN use graphql? Currently if we use gql the data source is hard coded

I think you can use the module field values via binding in the query, see an example at line 4 <https://github.com/HubSpot/recruiting-agency-graphql-theme/blob/master/src/data-queries/role_listings.graphql#L4C1-L5C1>
Is this what you are looking for?

So in that example the collections are manually grabbed (`p_role_collection`).

But I’m looking to see if a module field can control which collection to use for _a newly created object or hubdb table_.

Currently a dev has to go in and update the query on a client’s request if they create new tables.

We're having a issue with the front end of HubSpot glitching up at times and not completely showing records. Support seems about as useful as talking to a basketball, is there anyway to get something escalated?
ah, I think thats not doable now. Let me brainstorm with the team and see if anybody has any other ideasl.
Or some other parts of HubSpot?

Nah, its a issue with the Calls API; we have recordings going into HS just fine, and we can see them in the Calls object and see them being associated to Contacts, but the actual recordings aren't showing up on the contacts themselves...but sometimes they will. It's random
ok, then <#C2YHAHB6K|api> may be the right channel. <@U2H3TT8F2> <@U7SL518D6> Can you point him to the right team, / contact for this issue?
Can you send me a DM with a link to one of the screens you’re seeing the issue on <@U04N6N424MB>? I can see what I can do on my end
